name: Smartlogic Semaphore
overview: Smartlogic Semaphore Ltd., a software and services company, offers semantic search platforms. It offers Semaphore, an open semantic platform for applications, such as enterprise search and enterprise content management. The companyâ€™s Semaphore enhances Solr’s native search with automated metadata tagging and an user interface; adds a level of navigation on the interface provided by a Google Search Appliance; adds taxonomy support for Microsoft SharePoint; improves search navigation and classification capabilities for Microsoft FAST ESP; and offers taxonomy support and content classification for OpenText (RedDot) content management system (CMS). Its Semaphore is also used for other applications, such as EPiServer Web and Alterian content manager, HP trim document and records management system, Lucene search platform, OpenText, SAXOTECH mediaware center, NUKE.net portal infrastructure and CMS, MarkLogic XML server, Oracle-based applications, and Amaxus Web CMS. In addition, Smartlogic Semaphore offers product professional services, such as consulting, training, and support. The company serves healthcare, media, publishing, research and development, government, and financial services sectors in Europe, the Middle East, and the Americas. Smartlogic Semaphore was incorporated in 2006 and is headquartered in London, the United Kingdom with operations in the United States and the United Kingdom.

acquisitions.source_description: Smartlogic acquires SchemaLogic, extending leadership in Content Intelligence
